sentence: The malware connects to the Command & Control (CnC) server.
original: The malware connects to the Command & Control (CnC) server.

sentence: It stores the logged keystrokes in the following file: [CWD]\.tmp When the "EXECUTABLE_0" malware is executed it : Creates a copy of itself in the following locations: %APPDATA% %USERNAME% Tries to open the following file: [CWD]\Authorization.exe.config Entrenches in the system for persistence in the following registry locations: REGISTRY_0 REGISTRY_1 Beacons to the following C2 node IP:.
original: It stores the logged keystrokes in the following file: [CWD]\.tmp When the "Authorization.exe" malware is executed it : Creates a copy of itself in the following locations: %APPDATA% %USERNAME% Tries to open the following file: [CWD]\Authorization.exe.config Entrenches in the system for persistence in the following registry locations: HKCU\...\bf7a7ffda58092e10 HKLM\...\bfda58092e10 Beacons to the following C2 node IP:.

sentence: * over TCP port 1177:"IP_0” Makes the following modification to the registry to bypass the Windows Firewall: REGISTRY_0 The downloaded file is decoded, written to disk as %APPDATA%\...\ccSvcHst The following files created when the EXECUTABLE_0 malware executed: EXECUTABLE_1 EXECUTABLE_2 EXECUTABLE_3 and EXECUTABLE_4 are created by EXECUTABLE_5.
original: * over TCP port 1177:"217.66.231.245” Makes the following modification to the registry to bypass the Windows Firewall: HKLM\...\msnco.exe The downloaded file is decoded, written to disk as %APPDATA%\...\ccSvcHst The following files created when the Authorization.exe malware executed: msnco.exe authorization.EXE-0AD199D6.pf Msnco.exe and Authorization.EXE-0AD199D6.pf are created by Authorization.exe.
